headline: Perspectives Pride Month 2021
summary: President Joe Biden formally declared Pride Monthon Tuesday, saying, "we recognize the resilience and determination of the many individuals who are fighting to live freely and authentically." This marked a departure from former President Donald Trump, who never acknowledged the celebrationoutside of a 2019 tweet thread. Pride Month received its first official declaration fromformer President Bill Clinton in June 1999. Also on Tuesday, Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis signed a laweffectively banning transgender student athletesfrom participating on teams associated with their gender identity, the latest in a series of Republican-backed state bills regarding transgender rights.Left- and center-rated outlets were more likely to publish opinion articles about Pride Month, with some outlets on all sides covering news stories like Biden's statement. Perspectives varied by topic, with some focusing on the celebration itself and others discussing recent controversies.
